meanings.definition: To throw or fling with great force
meanings.sent1: He hucks the ball across the field.
meanings.sent2: She hucks the frisbee to her friend at the park.
meanings.sent3: The superhero hucks the villain into the air with a mighty throw.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind hucks the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: The chef hucks the pizza dough high into the air to stretch it out.
meanings.sent6: With a powerful swing, he hucks the hammer over the fence.
meanings.sent7: She hucks the keys to her friend waiting outside.
meanings.sent8: The farmer hucks the hay bales onto the truck with ease.
meanings.sent9: The coach hucks the basketball to the player for a quick pass.
meanings.sent10: The storm hucks debris through the air, causing chaos.

meanings.sent3: The little hucks at the park were playing tag.
meanings.sent4: She's the biggest hucks in our class, always making us laugh.
meanings.sent5: The old car was nicknamed 'Old Huck' by the neighborhood kids.
meanings.sent6: The team captain was known as the hucks of the team.
meanings.sent7: The teacher referred to the students as her little hucks.

meanings.sent9: The hucks of the family was the family dog, always by their side.
